intro: Lysionotus pauciflorus var. latifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved starburst, is a species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its striking floral display.
